#Text=Get Your Boating License
#Text=If you want to operate a boat or jet ski under the age of 18 , you will need to obtain a boating license .
#Text=Operating a boat or jet ski without a license under the age of 18 is illegal .
#Text=In order to get a boating license you will need to find a course , take a class , and pass a test .
#Text=If you make it through each stage , you will be able to obtain your license and enjoy boating legally and safely .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Finding a Course
#Text=Look on a state level .
#Text=Boat licensing is done on a state level and you will need to research your state 's requirements .
#Text=Every state will have some variance in the requirements that will need to be met .
#Text=Try doing some research into your state 's requirements to learn more about what you need to do to obtain your license .
#Text=You can try looking at the DMV 's website http://www.dmv.org/boat-registration.php
#Text=Some states have exceptions for vessels without motors .
#Text=You may not need to have a license or register something like a canoe or kayak .
#Text=Other states may not require any licenses at all .
#Text=Choose on-line or in person classes .
#Text=Many states will offer both on-line and in person classes .
#Text=Both types of classes will allow you to obtain your boating license in the same way .
#Text=Picking the right learning environment for your needs can help you successfully get your boating license .
#Text=Online courses provide lectures and tests in the same way in-class lectures do .
#Text=You can check for online classes at http://www.boaterexam.com/
#Text=Your state will have their own website for in-person classes .
#Text=Be ready to pay the fees .
#Text=In order to enroll in a boating license course , you will need to pay the course fee .
#Text=The exact fee will vary between states .
#Text=You will need to do some research into what the fee is for your own state or on-line course to learn more .
#Text=For example , New York state generally charges around $ 10.00 per course .
#Text=Some online courses are $ 29.95
#Text=Some online courses only charge you when you pass the exam .
#Text=Preparing for the Exam
#Text=Learn boat safety .
#Text=Parts of the boating exam will test how much you know about boating safety .
#Text=These topics will allow you to demonstrate that you can keep your boat in working order , make sure you are prepared for emergencies , and ensure that you can operate your boat correctly .
#Text=Expect some of these questions to appear on the test :
#Text=Where should you place a fire extinguisher on your boat ?
#Text=What should you do in case of a fire ?
#Text=Which boats are most likely to capsize ?
#Text=Learn the best boating practices .
#Text=There are many rules and practices that you and other boaters should be aware of .
#Text=These rules will help make sure everyone is kept safe while boating , preventing any needless accidents from occurring .
#Text=You can expect to find questions like these on the exam :
#Text=What should a power boat approaching a sail boat in darkness do ?
#Text=Which direction does bad weather usually approach from ?
#Text=What side of your boat should you pass red markers on ?
#Text=What area is indicated by red and green buoys ?
#Text=Which side of the boat is the port side ?
#Text=Learn personal safety .
#Text=Although boating is a lot of fun , it can also present some dangers .
#Text=It 's important that you know how to keep you and your friends safe while out on the water .
#Text=You will likely see some questions that are similar to these on the test :
#Text=What are the symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning ?
#Text=What are the symptoms of hypothermia ?
#Text=How can you help someone recover from hypothermia ?
#Text=What is the H.E.L.P. position ?
#Text=Passing the Exam
#Text=Practice the test .
#Text=Before you take your boating license test , it can be a good idea to get in some practice .
#Text=There are a few options on-line that you can use to get a better understanding of what 's on the test .
#Text=Take some time to look over the practice exams to increase your chances of passing the exam .
#Text=You can find a practice exam here http://www.boaterexam.com/canada/practice/quiz.aspx
#Text=Study all material .
#Text=When you sign up to take a boating license exam , you will likely be given material to study .
#Text=This material is designed to educate you on the safe operation of boating vessels .
#Text=Make sure you fully review all information delivered to you as part of your course to allow you to successfully pass the exam .
#Text=Take the exam .
#Text=At the end of the course you will be given the final boating license examination .
#Text=This test will gauge how well you have retained all information presented throughout the course .
#Text=Passing the test will demonstrate that you are capable of safely operating a boating vessel and will grant you your boating license .
#Text=The exam will ask you questions that assess how much you know about boats and boating .
#Text=For example , you may be asked which side is the port side of a boat .
#Text=You may also be asked questions regarding the proper treatment of hypothermia .
#Text=You should know what to do while boating in stormy weather .
#Text=Obtain your license .
#Text=After you successfully pass your boating license exam and have paid any applicable fees , you will be allowed to obtain your license .
#Text=This license will ensure that you are obeying the law , staying safe , and observing proper boating practices .
#Text=Your license will likely be a small card , similar to a driver 's license .
#Text=You need to carry your license or boating education card with you while boating .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Check with your local state or government to learn more about the requirements .
#Text=Be ready to pay a fee to take the course and get your license .
#Text=Many states offer on-line boating courses , in addition to in-class courses .
#Text=There are practice exams available on-line .
#Text=Study all available material before taking your exam .
#Text=Not all states require you to have a boating license .
#Text=There are currently only five ( 5 ) US states that require a boating license for recreational craft .
#Text=Many states have " boating education " requirements without any certification or license .

column1: #Text=Some states wo n't require a license if you are using a non-motor driven boat .
